clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Epi-on Corneal Cross-linking in Eyes With Progressive Keratoconus
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multi-center Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Epithelium-on Corneal Collagen Cross-linking in Eyes With Progressive Keratoconus

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of epithelium-on corneal collagen cross-linking (CXL) in preventing the progression of, and/or reducing corneal curvature (Kmax) in eyes with progressive keratoconus. Epithelium-on CXL uses a formulation that allows the riboflavin to penetrate the cornea without the need to remove the epithelium, the outer most layer of the cornea.

detailed_description.textblock: Up to 275 study eyes with progressive keratoconus will be enrolled. Study eyes will be randomized in a 2:1 ratio to receive CXL treatment or sham/control treatment.The primary efficacy endpoint is a difference of ≥ 1 diopter between treatment groups in the mean change in Kmax from baseline to Month 6.

primary_outcome.description: Mean difference of at least 1 diopter in Kmax change from baseline between treatment groups

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Kmax between treatment groups

arm_group.description: Study eye receives Paracel 1, Paracel 2 R0185 and irradiated using KXL High Power System (10 J)
Sham eye receives Paracel Placebo and irradiated using KXL High Power System (2 J)

intervention.description: Two drops every 60 seconds for 4 minutes
Two drops of Paracel Placebo every 60 seconds for 4 minutes followed by two drops every 30 seconds for 6 minutes
Two drops every 30 seconds for 6 minutes
